hints.content:
Smaller numbers appear further left on the number line and larger numbers appear further right.

Numbers with the same value are in the same place on the number line.

Is the quotient $15\div 4$ less than, equal to, or greater than $4$?

No whole number value of $\blueE{{?}}$ makes this equation exactly true:

$\blueE{15 \div 4} = \blueE{{?}}$

Let's try some close equations to estimate the value of $\blueE{{?}}$.

$\begin{align}
\goldE{12 \div 4} &= \goldE{3}\\\\
\blueE{15 \div 4} &= \blueE{{?}}\\\\
\maroonE{16 \div 4} &= \maroonE{4}
\end{align}$

When the total gets larger and the number of groups is the same, then the group size get larger.

[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: A number line from 3 to 5, with a tick every 1 unit. There are 3 points. The point at 3 is labeled, "12 divided by 4." The point at 4 is labeled, "16 divided by 4." An unlabeled point is between the tick at 3 and the tick at 4. The unlabeled point is to the left of the point at 4. !

hints.content:
$\blueE{15\div 4}$ is between $\goldE{3}$ and $\maroonE{4}$.  So,  it is *less than* $4$.

[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: A number line from 3 to 5, with a tick every 1 unit. There are 2 points. A point labeled, "15 divided by 4," is between the tick at 3 and the tick at 4. It is to the left of the point at 4. !

hints.content:
$15\div 4$ appears to the *left* of $4$ on the number line.

[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: An open number line shows a point labeled, "15 divided by 4," to the left of a point labeled, "4." !

question.content:
**Which number line correctly compares $\blueE{15\div 4}$ with $\maroonE{4}$?**

[[☃ radio 1]]

choices.clue: This number line shows $15\div 4$ to the left of $4$, and $15\div 4$ is less than $16 \div 4$.
choices.content: ![An open number line shows a point labeled, "15 divided by 4," to the left of a point labeled, "4."](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/d550b630b4f605cc676abc59528dea57e75b1e37)

choices.clue: This number line shows $15\div 4$ at the same place as $4$, but $15\div 4$ does not equal $16 \div 4$.
choices.content: ![An open number line shows a point labeled, "15 divided by 4," at the same place as a point labeled, "4."](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/67308f1287a5626521d252ea1ef3688490e913f6)

choices.clue: This number line shows $15\div 4$ to the right of $4$, but $15\div 4$ is *not* greater than $16 \div 4$.
choices.content: ![An open number line shows a point labeled, "15 divided by 4," to the right of a point labeled, "4."](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/47470f78221d654ef8a1f8dfe65a36e42a543557)
